channel.title: Materials on Basics of data visualization for behavioral scientists
channel.description: Recent content in Materials on Basics of data visualization for behavioral scientists

item.title: Materials
item.description: Course materials The primary source for this course consists of a browser-readable book, which is used as a teaching aid in class but can also serve as a self-standing tutorial. The book can be found here. The two papers the data sets used in the course refer to are: Metonymies are more literal than metaphors: evidence from ratings of German idioms (Michl, 2019a) [here] Speedy Metonymy, Tricky Metaphor, Irrelevant Compositionality: How Nonliteralness Affects Idioms in Reading and Rating (Michl, 2019b) [here]
